about_the_game:
New action game from the makers of Gazmatera!

This project takes the best from the Mafia and Yakuza series, adds its own flavor and mixes it all in a blender.

The year is 1992.

Two dudes and one gal with an enormous-sized butt stole the suitcase full of money from a famous criminal boss, now everyone wants to kill them, including the customs, mafia, triads, cops, KGB, and CIA.

Your job is to make connections with those who are not against you, get rid of those who are against you, and overall, survive these hard times!

Featuring:

  • story from the masters of their craft (from the people behind the Gazmatera series)

  • full Wiimote support

  • realistic driving with steering wheel support

  • 11 playable characters

  • 15 chapters and 82 missions

  • 14 large cities opened for exploration

  • 20 bosses

  • 48 fully-modeled and driveable cars with unique features for each of them

  • sword combat and various types of firearms

  • cinematic-level cutscenes

  • two-languages dub

  • soundtrack from the underground Yugoslavian, Albanian and Baltic rock bands you never heard of (can be bought separately)

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Linux Mint 22 (AMD only), Ubuntu 18
  • Processor: Intel Core i3-4130 3.30 GHz
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: AMD Radeon HD 7750 (no NVidia support)
  • Storage: 23 GB available space
  • Sound Card: Built-in Sound card
  • VR Support: Too poor to implement this
  • Additional Notes: Disable Steam Input stuff to play on Steam Deck (it breaks the controls). Has known issues with Wayland on Intel graphics (use something else).
linux_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Ubuntu 20 (also Uwuntu), Debian 12 (Editor's Choice), RHEL 9, OpenSUSE 15 Leap, SteamOS 3 (requires install)
  • Processor: Intel Core i3-8100 3.60 GHz
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: AMD Radeon RX 580 4 GB (no NVidia support)
  • Storage: 23 GB available space
  • Sound Card: Generic Sound Card
  • VR Support: Too rich to implement this
  • Additional Notes: Doesn't work on: Manjaro (GPU driver issues), Gentoo, Raspbian x86, CentOS, ARM-based systems (AArch64). Performance can be lower than on the Windows due to the "under-the-hood" differences.

reviews:
“This game is a true treasure!”
10/10 – Uncle Gooey Games

“Let's be real, this game is ACTUALLY GOOD. Between "mediocre" and "great" if you know what i mean here :) but it lacks something. This gamedev product is a plot-orientated action with some wild humor and characters. And now, point by point. Visual. It's ain't bad by any means, but not without rough moments. Like, there's some locations, where the surroundings are too dark (like a neurotic man's dream), or they're too bright like you're looking at the train running at you on its full speed though the night. Sure, there's gamma correction settings and postprocessing presets, but would be better to fix that. Characters' design is decent overall (that's better than characters in my games at least!) they even moving their eyeballs in some cutscenes, holy Christ on a bike... But the other surroundings are not that great, because of the overall blandness of them. Story. As i mentioned before, the plot is interesting to say the least. There's a lot of well woven together plot twists, and a lot of pretty cool missions. Of course i'm not a prim movie buff, but it still was fascinating to follow. And i don't want to spoil stuff here (play this beauty by yourself!), but i LOVED the finale. Loved, but it almost break me in half by its ungodly, undogly, unholy, unhumanly brutal and cruel difficulty... Still, not very much a problem for the Dark Souls players. Missions. They're tailored from the same cloth but with different-colored threads, like there's mostly driving and shooting sections. But driving is the best part of the game. Imagine vibe of riding the 1950's 23 HP rustbucket throught the fields and meadows, listening to the jazz hits from the early 70's on the radio - that's like the next level of awesomeness! (bonus points if you've already did this in real life). Other missions ain't bad too, shooting sections and the bossfights are actually fun. But they're nicely crammed into the plot, so i can forgive them all their cons :) Sound design and music. Well, that's a matter of flavour, fifty-fifty y'know. Found some catchy songs in the last chapters, theme of the second bossfight in Chapter 15 has no rights to be that good (IIRC it was a German punk band named Tollwut), theme of the boat driving in chapter 9 forces me to actually stand up and dance... The music is briliant and fits the gameplay perfectly. Atmosperic, cheerfully. Overall vibe. It's UNREALISTICALLY GORGEOUS. Maximum immersion into the post-soviet criminal culture, with characters' own time-appropriate linguistic accents, shibbolets, quirks and jokes. A lot of easter eggs (and even more ones which you can't get due to the cultural barrier), fun staff, and at the same time, drama. This game uniroinically whips the llama's a~ i mean it slaps! 8/10.”
8/10 – Studio Roma

“Overall, Captain Gazman Day Of The Rage is a good choice for those who enjoy simple arcade games with some adventure elements.”
4.2/5 – DTF
